title: Thunderbird screen presentation
content:
Windows 10 Pro went to a black screen while I was editing a file. Thunderbird was running in the background. I had to do a hard re-boot. When I restarted Thunderbird, the Inbox presentation was different. See the attached file. How do I get the correct presentation back?

I tried bringing back a backup version of my profile (the whole folder tree). The presentation was OK this time but emails were lost. So, I brought back the corrupted(?) profile in order to get my recent emails.
creator: k3pto

title: Merging profiles?  (Help setting up profile from documents folder.)
content:
HELP!!

I am trying to move my Thunderbird profile (containing a huge number of mail files dating back to 1995!!) from a Windows 10 computer to a new Windows 11 computer. My active profile has been kept in my Documents file (for easier automatic cloud backup). I have spent days trying everything I can to make this work. The best I can do is two profiles, one that can check mail, but contains no historic mail or files -- the other that has all my emails but won't connect with my server. "The following is a special account." "There are no identities associated with it." I was wondering if I could merge these two profiles? Or?

Any assistance will be greatly appreciated!!!!!!!!

title: Thunderbird EDI messaging PKCS#7 argument error: malformed S/MIME encoded PKCS#7 object
content:
We are testing EDI messaging with a government department however it seems that Thunderbird keeps stripping the attachment before the email reaches the exchange and produces this error.

We sent 3 messages:

1. 2 had this error: PKCS#7 argument error: malformed S/MIME encoded PKCS#7 object 2. 1 had this error: no attachment on their end

PKI Certificate is installed in Thunderbird.
creator: user61594

title: Thunderbird from Mircosoft Store different to Thunderbird downloaded from Mozilla
content:
Yesterday I set up my Laptop with a new Windows 11 system from scratch. Then I installed Thunderbird from the Microsoft store and tried to paste the copied repository to the Profile Folder in %APPDATA%/Thunderbird/Profiles (as described here). And was astonished - there was none. All the folders as described in the Thunderbird settings (e.g. Local Folder, Profile Folder etc) are still descibed within Thunderbird to be there - but werent. When I clicked on "Open Folder" in the "Troubleshooting Information" - Page - I got an error, that it is not there).

I had to delete Thunderbird and learned by that, it iis installed as an App - it cannot be removed as programs are removed.

So I am left with the question: How to migrate the repository of Thunderbird is installed as App from the Microsoft Store? Where are the data persisted?
creator: Ulrich-Dieter.Schmidt

title: Loss of access to Thunderbird Local Folders list and contents
content:
Currently using Thunderbird v143.0.1 on a Windows 10 Pro desktop computer. Since about 17 July 2025, I have not been able to access all of my Local Folders and/or content messages. There are 39 primary local folders displayed with an additional 27 not displayed. However, by navigating through the User AppData folder structure as follows: C:\Users\Ken\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\k1fx5scw.default\Mail\Local Folders, I am able to see the missing folders and messages, just not able to access them from within Thunderbird.

Is my problem a Thunderbird setting value or have I run into a physical limitation of the application?
creator: BarickmanKen

title: Can't import accounts from Outlook desktop (MS365)
content: The import tool offers to import accounts and settings from Outlook, but runniing it fails to import any of the 8 accounts I have configured. 7 of the accounts are IMAP/SMTP, one is a Google Workspace (GWS) account synchronized via GWSMO. Import Accounts and Settings finishes instantly with no error messages but imports nothing. Import Address Books takes longer but appears to import all contacts regardless of source in Outlook into one local address book. There is no differentiation between the GWS address book and the various local address books configured in Outlook. The Import Calendar option is disabled. Import Mail Messages hung but seemed to import at least all local message folders as well as the GWS mail messages. Thunderbird is 143.0.1 (32-bit) running under Windows Pro x64 22H2.
creator: rsbrux

title: thunderbird account corrupted Ghost Files - how to repair
content:
Hi, I’m using an IMAP account in Thunderbird and connecting to a Microsoft Exchange server.

I've done several tests and it seems like my account might be corrupted. When I try to move or delete a folder in Thunderbird, it doesn’t work — the folder name appears in italics. Also when I rename a folder, it creates another on in italics

I also tried moving a folder directly on the Exchange server. But when I reopened Thunderbird, the folder didn’t appear in its new location. Instead, it stayed in the same place, showed up in italics, and the emails inside were missing. Fortunately, the emails weren’t deleted — they’re still in the folder, but only visible from the Exchange server.

Here are the anomalies I’ve noticed:

- There are two profile folders in the data directory - I have two trash folders: one labeled "Deleted Items" and another local folder called "Corbeille" - I see multiple ghost folders with no emails inside but only in thunderbird app in the laptop, I've got no problem in android app.

And here are the screenshots
creator: paola11

title: thunderbird　143.0.1にバージョンアップしたら、エラーメッセージが出て起動しなくなりました。

title: Thunderbird - cannot save email attachments locally
content:
Dear Community,

I just encountered the following issue with Thunderbird after installting the tool on my new laptop: When I click "save" in an email with an attachment, the "Save attachment" window pops up and I can browse to a local folder. But when I click "Save" and then check the corresponding folder, nothing has been saved.

I've searched the Thunderbird Settings menu up and down for a setting/option that will fix this issue, but I couldn't find one.

I've been using Thunderbird for many years, and I've never come across this issue before. I'm at my wits' end, so I'm hoping for your support!
creator: mephared

title: Failure to set up my outlook.com email address in version 143.0.1 (default release)
content:
My friend was unable to configure his outlook.com email address in Thunderbird (143.0.1) while I had no problem doing so in mine (140.3.0esr). We both had installed other email addresses already configured with no problem. I upgraded my second laptop from the esr version to his recommended release version, and hey presto, I suffered the same fate. This is definitely a bug within Thunderbird 143.0.1 which is the current release version.

I had not previously added the outlook email to Tbird as it is not my main email address.

More info: The error message encountered was:

Authentication failed: Please check the username and password

When you click on the "More information" link, it says:

"Exchange auth error"

Please note that we checked the username and password and verified them as correct. I addition, I was successful using that username/password on the 140 esr version and it worked perfectly.
creator: brian290

title: Thunderbird and Gmail
content:
Hi,

Trying to wade through the Gmail craziness with Thunderbird. I don't mind if TB has to go to the Gmail servers to retrieve an old email, I just don't want anything but the headers taking up space on my hard drive. Thanks much!

Don
